We are joining the AHRP Virtual Christmas Celebrations on the 11th of December, with an exciting lineup of homegrown brands and activities!

Register and purchase tickets by sending an email to virtual.christmas.cheer@gmail.com and join us one this season's festivities

HR Professionals Sri Lanka
December 6 at 11:36 PM ¬∑

Time to get your Christmas cheer on with our exciting entertainment lineup for the 11th of December! Get ready for an exciting appearance by Mrs. Claus, a special story reading by StoryLand SL, a live craft show by The Kamen and a musical line up of popular Sri Lankan artistes, including Amarsha Tissera, Tehani Tissera, Sheran Dilantha, Medhavi Jayaratne, and more! To register and purchase your tickets soon, send us an email to virtual.christmas.cheer@gmail.com.

column2:
Today kickstarts #16daysofactivism against gender based violence. As an organization that functions to support survivors of abuse, we have experienced the chain of reactions that gender based violence bring upon its victims. Today we invite you to pledge along with us; to never commit. To always intervene. And to never be a bystander. Silence allows violence; I won‚Äôt be silent to enable violence.

#16DaysOfActivism #genderbasedviolence #SupportSurvivors #emergestrong

column2:
2020's been a challenging year for all of us, but in times like these is when we should reflect on ourselves the most. Here's a photo from today's session of thinking and reflecting. This only helped us to appreciate our tiny but mighty team even more; a team driven with talent, love and so much passion for the work we do. We are forever grateful for being able to work with each other, but even more hopeful to face whatever storms 2021 will bring to us to keep empowering our amazing survivors ‚ú®

#emergestrong #bringon2021

column2:
We are so excited for our amazing founder who will be speaking with the dynamic ladies at Simply Unique! Please mark your calendar for Saturday 5 December and learn about Alia's Emerge journey!

Simply Unique added a new photo to the album: SIMPLY ONLINE ‚Äî with Alia Whitney-Johnson at Emerge Global.
November 5 at 11:30 AM ¬∑

Simply Online is pleased to announce our second Guest Speaker.

Alia Whitney-Johnson is an experienced social entrepreneur with fifteen years of experience working with children who‚Äôve endured trauma, sexual abuse, and exploitation.

During the summer of 2005, at the age of 19, Alia arrived in Sri Lanka as a tsunami-relief volunteer. During this trip, she encountered a heartbreaking reality: Girls as young as 11 who had survived rape or incest and had the courage to stand up for themselves in court were often cast out of their own families and placed in protective shelters away from society where they had little access to education or support.

That summer, she launched Emerge (www.emergeglobal.org) as a way to connect the girls to critical life and business skills, healing resources, and a community of support. Since then, Emerge has gone on to serve over 1,100 powerful young women.

Alia is also the Co-Founder and Executive Director of Freedom Forward (www.Freedom-Forward.org), a non-profit that is working to prevent the commercial sexual exploitation of youth in San Francisco through systems change. Through this role, she served as the Co-Chair of San Francisco‚Äôs Youth Trafficking Committee for the Mayor‚Äôs Task Force on Anti-Human Trafficking in 2017 and 2018, where she started the task force‚Äôs first Youth Advisory Board. She also helped form a collaborative of organizations to provide a full continuum of wrap-around services to youth who have or may experience commercial sexual exploitation.

Previously, Alia served as a consultant at McKinsey & Company and worked at LeanIn.org. She has served on several boards including the MIT Corporation (MIT‚Äôs board of trustees), SERES Global, Emerge Lanka Foundation, and ATHack!. Whitney-Johnson holds a B.S. in Civil and Environmental Engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and an MPhil in Development Studies from the University of Oxford, where she studied as a Rhodes Scholar.
column3: We are so excited for our amazing founder who will be speaking with the dynamic ladies at Simply Unique! Please mark your calendar for Saturday 5 December and learn about Alia's Emerge journey!
column4:
Simply Unique added a new photo to the album: SIMPLY ONLINE ‚Äî with Alia Whitney-Johnson at Emerge Global.
November 5 at 11:30 AM ¬∑

Simply Online is pleased to announce our second Guest Speaker.

Alia Whitney-Johnson is an experienced social entrepreneur with fifteen years of experience working with children who‚Äôve endured trauma, sexual abuse, and exploitation.

During the summer of 2005, at the age of 19, Alia arrived in Sri Lanka as a tsunami-relief volunteer. During this trip, she encountered a heartbreaking reality: Girls as young as 11 who had survived rape or incest and had the courage to stand up for themselves in court were often cast out of their own families and placed in protective shelters away from society where they had little access to education or support.

That summer, she launched Emerge (www.emergeglobal.org) as a way to connect the girls to critical life and business skills, healing resources, and a community of support. Since then, Emerge has gone on to serve over 1,100 powerful young women.

Alia is also the Co-Founder and Executive Director of Freedom Forward (www.Freedom-Forward.org), a non-profit that is working to prevent the commercial sexual exploitation of youth in San Francisco through systems change. Through this role, she served as the Co-Chair of San Francisco‚Äôs Youth Trafficking Committee for the Mayor‚Äôs Task Force on Anti-Human Trafficking in 2017 and 2018, where she started the task force‚Äôs first Youth Advisory Board. She also helped form a collaborative of organizations to provide a full continuum of wrap-around services to youth who have or may experience commercial sexual exploitation.

Previously, Alia served as a consultant at McKinsey & Company and worked at LeanIn.org. She has served on several boards including the MIT Corporation (MIT‚Äôs board of trustees), SERES Global, Emerge Lanka Foundation, and ATHack!. Whitney-Johnson holds a B.S. in Civil and Environmental Engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and an MPhil in Development Studies from the University of Oxford, where she studied as a Rhodes Scholar.

column2:
Our team is completed with individuals who believe in our cause to their fullest and go above and beyond to ensure that we reach higher peaks.

Meet Ashani, someone who is extremely dedicated to our cause and even more dedicated and passionate about empowering our girls. Ashani joined our team in 2017, and currently functions as our Reintegration and Admin Manager. Especially during these challenging times, Ashani has been our force of support, keeping the team grounded and positive. Soft spoken, but highly intelligent and always thinking two steps ahead, Ashani has effortlessly created some great connections for our girls, who fondly call her ‚ÄòAkki‚Äô. She‚Äôs such a loyal, trustworthy and a dependable figure in our team, committed to make a big difference in the work we do and who we do it for. We are really lucky and blessed to have Ashani in our team.

column2:
At Emerge Lanka Foundation, together with our sister organisation, Emerge Global, we work with young survivors of sexual abuse. We value and encourage the young women in our programmes to heal and emerge on their own terms.

We support and advocate for body autonomy, self-determination, and the ability to be the best version of ourselves. We celebrate those who choose to stand up and honor their deepest truths - who are brave enough to claim their truth even when society challenges or harms them for these truths.

No one should be penalized, harassed, or subjected to the inhumane treatment that many members of the LGBTQI community has recently suffered. To those who have lost your freedom or suffered violence at the hands of others, we see you.

We condemn the violence recently taken against the LGBTQI community in Sri Lanka.

To the LGBTQI community, we stand with you and for you. Today, and every day.

Aritha Wickramasinghe
October 30 at 5:05 AM ¬∑

Judicial Medical Officers and #Police have been exposed conducting forced #anal and #vaginal examinations on #LGBT Sri Lankans. These exams are done to ‚Äúprove‚Äù #homosexuality and to use as evidence to prosecute LGBT people.

These exams are degrading, cruel and amounts to torture. They have been banned by world bodies including the World Health Organization (WHO) and World Medical Association - WMA. The Sri Lanka Medical Association and Sri Lanka Medical Council are yet to issue any statement condemning these cruel exams. There is no requirement in law to conduct them and the #JusticeMinistry must request all their #JMOs to stop conducting them. The #AttorneyGeneral must also direct all Police to stop arresting and harassing #LGBT people.

In one case the JMO put two of his fingers inside the vaginas of both a #transgenderman and a cis #woman asked them if it hurt. They were also subject to more physical examinations in front of other male nurses and doctors. When they pleaded with the doctor not to insert his fingers inside again, the doctor said that he will light a firecracker next.

It is ironic that the Police want to #prosecute LGBT people for consensual relationships by getting doctors to forcefully probe our anus‚Äô and vaginas with their fingers. It‚Äôs very clear here who has committed the offence, and it‚Äôs not us! Only perverts order and conduct these exams.

Great work by Daily Mirror in exposing these practices and violations. We can only hope for justice for LGBT people and the victims of these examinations.

#Equality #lovewillwin #lovewins

http://www.dailymirror.lk/news-features/JMOs-and-Police-conducting-forced-anal-and-vaginal-examinations-on-LGBT-people/131-198911

column2:
Daily progress adding up to big victories.

All our participants enrolled in the beads-to-business program learn the basics of jewelry creation by creating these short necklaces; it‚Äôs the first step to practicing the art of beading to master the skills that goes into creating their own masterpiece.

Since our programs are self paced, we encourage them to take their time learning this well, so that they can create beautiful, high quality pieces of jewelry that act as their own avenue of income.
column3:
Daily progress adding up to big victories.

All our participants enrolled in the beads-to-business program learn the basics of jewelry creation by creating these short necklaces; it‚Äôs the first step to practicing the art of beading to master the skills that goes into creating their own masterpiece.

Since our programs are self paced, we encourage them to take their time learning this well, so that they can create beautiful, high quality pieces of jewelry that act as their own avenue of income.

column2:
Do join us on Facebook Live at 6.30pm (24 October) via Simply Unique to get some insight into the work we do through Emerge, and how you too can be a proactive member in creating change while empowering survivors of sexual abuse.

Simply Unique is with Shalini Fernando at Emerge Global.
October 23 at 9:25 AM ¬∑

We will be talking about:

1. The work Emerge does in Sri Lanka regarding survivors of underaged rape

2. The short term and long term Impacts of Institutionalisation

3. The social stigma surrounding underaged rape victims

Tune in to our live chat tomorrow at 6:30pm Colombo, Sri Lanka time.

These lovely ladies will speak for 30mins and take as many of your questions as possible.

column2:
Everyday as we go on with our work, we are continuously surprised at the resilience our Emerge Girls show. Despite going through so much in life, our girls try their very best to build a tomorrow that‚Äôs different from their yesterday. On this International Day of the Girl Child, we celebrate our courageous girls of whom we are proud beyond any measure.

#DayoftheGirl #GenerationEquality #EmergeStrong

column2: Truly grateful for our generous community for always lending a helping hand.
column3: Truly grateful for our generous community for always lending a helping hand.

column2:
In our avenue of work having supportive, kind and self-reflecting Program Officers make all the difference for our girls to be inspired to push further.

Suzanne is one such mentor that we've been lucky to have on our side since March this year. Suzanne joined us with experience in teaching children of all ages for over 23 years. Naturally motivated with the greatest attitude any educator can have, Suzanne is always encouraging those around her with a jolly mood. It didn't take us too long to fall in love with her when she came bearing loads of love. Suzanne's great listening skills, her undying empathy and her love to learn and improve her own skills have proven to be a blessing to our girls especially during this very challenging year. Today and everyday, we celebrate Suzanne and her vibrant and inspiring personality for joining hands with us to strive for a change in our world.

column2:
When a community comes together, beautiful things flourish.

Our heartiest gratitude goes out to The EPFS Community here on Facebook for a generous contribution that will support our courageous girls and our mission.

In a time where the social media space brings in many concerns regarding our children, we are glad and humbled to see good samaritans emerge and collaborate to keep the flame of good faith burning.

column2: The United Nations Convention is the Rights of the Child (CRC) is an internationally accepted document that defines the rights of all children. The document covers vital information about a child‚Äôs protection, their rights and our responsibilities towards them.

column2:
Thank you to Daily Mirror and International Christmas Charity Bazaar Sri Lanka for giving us the opportunity to talk about our work. ICCB has been one of our greatest supporters over the years, standing alongside our cause and our girls.

column2:
Dhammika is one of our Centre Mother's who shoulders the responsibility of caring for the girls under our care. Her gentle, kind and empathetic personality makes her a strong mother figure to our girls who've gone through many challenges in their lives. Passionately dedicated to the Emerge mission, Dhammika always has a story to draw inspiration and strength from. Our girls lovingly call her Amma; for her kindness and always lending an attentive ear to all their concerns.

Dhammika is not only a strength to the Emerge girls, but for all of us, who rest assured whenever she takes on any responsibility.

column2: As we celebrate International Youth Day, we are reminded of the constant and essential change that the youth in our communities are capable of creating. Day in day out, we work with young men and women who are committed to challenge the norm and make our world a better place. We at Emerge celebrate the spirit of the youth and their relentless braveness, today and everyday.

column2: We invite our community to take a stand against child sexual abuse. Our voice is our biggest power
column3: let‚Äôs use it responsibly to bring change to our children at risk.
column4: We invite our community to take a stand against child sexual abuse. Our voice is our biggest power
column5: let‚Äôs use it responsibly to bring change to our children at risk.

column2:
Aritha Wickramasinghe
July 18 at 3:31 PM ¬∑

In the last 24 hours, 3 girl children were brutally #raped and #killed in Sri Lanka! Most of the accused are young men below the age of 30.

Child sexual abuse and rape is endemic in #SriLanka with the police, courts and education authorities still doing very little to stem the problem.

The average rape case takes 14 years in Sri Lanka with only 1 rape conviction in 2018.

What kind of men are coming out of our schools? What exactly are our schools teaching them for them to be raping and killing young baby girls?

In 2019, the then Government withdrew an age appropriate #sexeducation book for children because of some made up cultural sensitivity.

In 2018, the members of the present Sri Lankan Government, while in opposition, falsely accused Think Equal of trying to spread #homosexuality to young children.

#ThinkEqual was actually teaching children values such as #respect, #kindness and #compassion. The programme was created out of the need to end violence against women following the brutal gang rape of a medical student in a bus in Delhi.

The failures by our political leaders to address these issues and their active participation to prevent solutions make them responsible for the crimes against these girls.

Where is the justice for our girls and women?

column2:
Our Senior Program Officer Nirukshi, or as fondly called ‚ÄòNiru Amma‚Äô by our girls, have been with us since our beginning 13 years ago. A uniquely creative individual, she loves anything colorful and quirky. This is why she‚Äôs the ideal person to guide our girls with their Beads to Business creations, helping the girls with creative color matching and being the strength they seek.

One of our favorite things about Nirukshi is how committed she is to our girls. She always makes sure to write small notes of encouragement to show them how loved and appreciated they are in our community. Nirukshi, thank you for all that you do; we are grateful to have you as a part of our team.

column2: We mourn the passing of our dear friend, champion, and long-term Emerge supporter Lilamani Dias Benson. We are sending our love her family, friends, and all of those who she impacted. üß° Grateful for the mark you have left on us, Lilamani.
